sponsor.partnerMessage: Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Their patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. They prioritize listening to and caring for their patients. Learn more here.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
It's the weekend again! Glad you're here, we have some weekend fun for you:

  • Soccer: The Hogs are playing the Hokies tonight at 6:30! Be there!
  • Shopping: The first Holiday Market of the season in Fayetteville is this Saturday.
  • Skate: Put on some wool socks and head out to The Rink for the opening day!
  • Live: There is going to be some epic guitar playing by Richard Thompson at the Faulkner PAC this weekend.
  • Tis the season: It's that time again for the Holidaze pop-up bars in Fayetteville. Opening night is tonight.
  • Bike: It's Springdale's turn for the ALL Cross series this Saturday.
  • Street shop: A Crystal Bridges/Momentary pop-up holiday shop opens this Saturday.
  • Lights: A couple city squares are lighting up this weekend, and you don't want to miss it.
  • Gather: Check out over 30 local vendors at a fundraising holiday expo this Saturday.

Have a wonderful weekend. We'll see you Monday!

posts.title: A New Take On Fashion
posts.content:
A new, free visual arts exhibition will be in the Momentary next week, and you fashionistas are going to love it. 

  • Fabric and colors: The exhibition is a group original called In Some Form or Fashion exploring the cultural implications of fashion. The work of six artists will be represented in a site-responsive, large-scale installation from Nov. 20 - March 13, 2022. 
  • Story through clothes: The installation is meant to illuminate the many ways people can assert individuality and identity through clothing as well as depict the history of fashion in both reality and the imagination. 

 For more information and tickets, click HERE.

posts.title: Raise The Roof
posts.content:
Dickson Street is getting a new resident, and everything we love about city life, restaurants, and live music just got a little bit better. 

  • Jam packed: Nashville-based Tin Roof is leasing the building on Dickson and West that used to be occupied by Hog Haus Brewing Co. The restaurant will have a full menu, a bar, and patio seating on both levels as well as a beer garden out back.
  • Music in the streets: There will be entertainment on all levels and live music seven nights a week from all different genres, levels of fame, and parts of the country. The goal is for Tin Roof to be open this coming Spring. 

Read Fayetteville Flyer’s story HERE for more.

posts.title: The New Nice List?
posts.content:
Fayetteville is one of 95 cities across the globe that the CDP recognized as an ‘A List’ city. 

  • Targets: The A List is comprised of leading cities in the fight against climate change — cities that are making progress toward ambitious goals. An A List city is also one that publicly discloses its city-wide emissions inventory, has a published climate action plan, and has an adaption plan to climate vulnerability and hazards.
  • Momentum: Fayetteville is right there with the other A List cities, identifying opportunities for sustainability and clean technology. A couple of Fayetteville’s goals are to divert 40% of waste from the landfill by 2027, and have 100% clean energy by 2050. 

Learn more about Fayetteville’s accomplishments HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Ride: The Cyclocross World Championships are in Fayetteville in January and tickets are on sale now!
  • Roads: Arkansas is 17th in the nation when it comes to highways.
  • Future: So now we're out here looking at drone delivery services.
  • Learning: Fayetteville education just got a sizable contribution.
  • Top notch: J.B. Hunt is in the top 10 for being a military friendly employer.
  • Getting out there: The Fayetteville Public Library has plans to launch a Makers Market for entrepreneurs.
